Package model

Class User

Object
model.User
Direct Known Subclasses:
Consumer, EntertainmentProvider, GovernmentRepresentative
public abstract class User
extends Object
User is an abstraction, containing common state and behaviours shared by different kinds of users: Consumers, EntertainmentProviders, and GovernmentRepresentatives.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Modifier Constructor Description
    protected User​(String email, String password, String paymentAccountEmail)
    Create a new User and save the user email and payment account email, but do not save the password in plaintext! This would be a security disaster, because a hacker could easily get it out of the application.

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      protected User​(String email, String password, String paymentAccountEmail)
      Create a new User and save the user email and payment account email, but do not save the password in plaintext! This would be a security disaster, because a hacker could easily get it out of the application. Instead, hash the user password using BCrypt - in other words, transform the password into another string, using a library that always turns the same password into the same string (called a hash), but there is no way easy way to reverse the hash back to the password. This allows to check whether someone entered the correct password without ever storing the password itself, only a hash that cannot be easily reversed.
      Parameters:
      email - new user email address (will be used to log in with)
      password - new user password (will be hashed and the hash will be used to verify future logins)
      paymentAccountEmail - email address that corresponds to an account in the PaymentSystem
      See Also:
      BCrypt library on GitHub that integrates with Gradle

  • Method Details

    • getEmail

      public String getEmail()

    • setEmail

      public void setEmail​(String newEmail)

    • checkPasswordMatch

      public boolean checkPasswordMatch​(String password)
      Check whether the stored password hash matches the hash of the specified password. You can use return BCrypt.verifyer().verify(password.toCharArray(), passwordHash).verified;
      Parameters:
      password - password to hash and check
      Returns:
      True if the passwords match and false if they do not

    • updatePassword

      public void updatePassword​(String newPassword)
      Update the stored password hash to a new one, corresponding to the specified password. You can use passwordHash = BCrypt.withDefaults().hashToString(12, newPassword.toCharArray());
      Parameters:
      newPassword - password to update the stored hash with
